Only a Wish spell can bring a Greater Soulburner back from this Death. As it was not the death itself, but the burning of every last bit of their soul that led to their demise.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Dragonsoul
entries: With this path, you forge a contract with a powerful dragon, slowly changing your soul forever.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Contract
entries: You have successfully established a contract with a dragon of significant power. This contract will forever change your soul. Slowly turning you more towards the draconic.
The type of dragon that you have made a contract with also indicated your damage type for future Dragonsoul features.
Additionally you can speak, read and write Draconic.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Defense
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, draconic features manifest themselves on your body. While you are wearing no armor, your armor class is equal to 10 + Dexterity modifier + (Chosen mental stat) modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Form
entries: At 3rd level you learn how to temporarily unleash your soul's draconic power.

The cosmetic characteristics of this transformation are determined by you, making them a personalized and distinctive feature of your character. The only stipulation is that this transformation still needs to resemble your original humanoid form.
As a bonus action, you can assume your dragon form for 1 minute.
While transformed, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your jaw becomes elongated and you grow sharp fangs. Bite becomes a natural weapon for you that deals 1d6 piercing damage on a hit. You can use either Strength or Dexterity. Bite damage grows to a d8 at level 7, and again to a d10 at level 10, and finally to a d12 at level 15.

You grow sharp and deadly claws. Claw becomes a natural weapon for you that deals 1d4 piercing damage on a hit. You can use either Strength or Dexterity. Claw can be used both as an Action or Bonus Action. Claw damage grows to a d6 at level 7, and again to a d8 at level 10, and finally to a d10 at level 15.

entries: Your natural weapons from your Dragon Form can be infused by your {@classFeature Soul Infusion|Soulburner|ToL|2} feature.
You can use this feature equal to your Proficiency Bonus. Once you have expended all uses, you must finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Breath
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you can unleash the destructive draconic powers that have been accumulating in your soul.

As an action you can exhale a 30-foot cone of Draconic breath. The damage as well as Saving Throw type is related to your Draconic Contract. Each creature in the cone must make a saving throw against your Soul Power DC, taking (Proficiency Bonus x Soulburn Die) on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Afterward you also suffer the Draconic Breath damage rolled as necrotic damage.
The Draconic Breath Cone is increased to a 60-foot cone at level 15.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Growth
entries: At 7th level, whenever you transform into your Dragon Form, you now grow to the large size.
While in your Dragon Form, you have an extra 10ft of speed.
Any attacks you make from your natural weapons now count as magical.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Resistance
entries: At 7th level, you become resistant to the chosen damage type in your draconic contract.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Wings
entries: At 10th level, your Dragon Form now sprout a pair of wings from your back, gaining a flying speed equal to your current speed.
You can't manifest your wings while wearing armor unless the armor is made to accommodate them, and clothing not made to accommodate your wings might be destroyed when you manifest them.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Draconic Growth
entries: At 10th level, your Dragon Form now lasts for 10 minutes. Your form grows, as it now also includes a tail being up to 10ft long.
You can use your tail as a natural weapon, dealing {@dice 1d8} bludgeoning  damage on a hit. You can use either Strength or Dexterity.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Attacks
entries: At 15th level, whenever you use the attack action while in your Dragon Form. You can unleash a barrage of natural weapon attacks. You make one with your bite, one with claw and one with your tail.
You can use this feature three times per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Presence
entries: Beginning at 15th level, your soul holds the presence of a true dragon.

As an action you can unleash a roar, each creature within 80 feet of you and aware of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Soul Power DC or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
You can use this feature once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Ultimate Dragon Soul
entries: At 20th level, you have reached the pinnacle of your Dragon Form.
Now each time you enter your Dragon Form as a bonus action. You can choose to transform into an adult version of your Dragon Type, instead of the humanoid version of your Dragon Form.

items: You can now stay in this form for however long you want.
You gain a flying speed of 80ft, as well as a climbing speed of 40ft.
You grow to the size of huge.
You are immune to your related damage type.
Your Draconic Breath damage is increased to 12d12 and you now only take half of the rolled damage as necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Puppeteer Sorcerery
entries: {@italic Created By : Victor}

Puppeteer sorcerers, whispered to be Velena's children, wield the dark art of manipulation. Hailing from the elusive Black Rose organization, these enigmatic sorcerers instill fear across Lumeeria. Their mastery over behind-the-scenes control, akin to the rumored powers of The Black Rose, chills the hearts of those who possess valuable secrets. Feared for their ability to puppeteer destinies, Puppeteer sorcerers embody the unsettling legacy of Velena's shadowy offspring, leaving an indelible mark on the lands they tread.

subclassFeature.name: Puppeteer Spells
entries: You gain additional spells at the indicated levels, as shown below. They are considered sorcerer spells for you, and do not count towards the total number of spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Pull the Strings
entries: Your charming demeanor is enough to let you get a grip on anyone’s mind, letting your words cut through doubt like daggers. You gain proficiency in Persuasion, or expertise if you are already proficient in it. Additionally, you can give yourself advantage on a Persuasion check an amount of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per long rest, utilizing basic manipulation to influence others.

subclassFeature.name: Controlled Companion
entries: You can control the movements of smaller objects with ease, tricking those around you into believing they contain some sort of life. You can perform a Connection Ritual by spending 10 minutes concentrating on a Tiny object, holding it throughout the process. After the 10 minutes have passed, invisible strings connect your fingetips to the object, letting you manipulate it at a distance up to 60 feet, and if the object would have a way of seeing, it can act as if you had casted {@spell Find Familiar}. The object has an AC of 10 + your PB, and has 1 hit point and becomes unusable if it takes any damage. It is immune to psychic damage.
An object connected to you lasts until you perform the ritual again or if it is destroyed. While the object is connected to you, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your sorcerer spells.

subclassFeature.name: No One's Marionette
entries: You gain resistance to Psychic damage, as well as advantage on saves against being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}.

subclassFeature.name: Force The Hand
entries: Your ability to charm and control others has grown significantly, allowing you to temporarily change the flow of combat to your advantage. As an Action, you can spend 2 sorcery points to attempt to puppeteer a creature within 60 feet of you. If a creature has Legendary Actions, or similar abilities, they are automatically immune to this feature.

The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, becoming Bound to you on a failed save. While bound, you can use your bonus action to decide what action the Bound creature will take. If you try to command it to do something that would bring direct harm to itself (Jumping in a pit of spikes, leaping out of a window, etc.), the target immediately escapes the bind. A Bound creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of their turn.
When you reach 11th level in this class, you can have 2 creatures Bound at the same time. When you reach 16th level in this class, you can have 3 creatures Bound at the same time.

subclassFeature.name: What Is Dead May Never Die
entries: Over time, you have realized that fallen warriors are not entirely useless, as long as you know how to work with a dead body. Luckily for you, you do. When a small or medium humanoid creature within 60 feet of you falls to 0 HP, you can use your reaction to cause ethereal strings to hold it upright, gaining a temporary ally. You can use a Bonus action on each of your turns to control the creature, which has the statistics of a Skeleton with any and all appropriate changes. When using your reaction, you can also spend sorcery points to empower your hold over the deceased target, giving it an amount of Temporary Hit Points equal to 5 times the amount of sorcery points spent + half your level (Rounded up) in this class. You are considered to be concentrating on this.

subclassFeature.name: Unwilling Devotion
entries: When a creature is affected by an Enchantment spell you cast, or a subclass feature, you can attempt to change their memory, as with {@spell Modify Memory} cast at its base level.

subclassFeature.name: Sever the Strings
entries: When a creature is freed from either {@subclassFeature Force the Hand|Sorcerer||Puppeteer|ToL|6} or an Enchantment you have cast on them, you can use your reaction and spend sorcery points to deal psychic damage to the creature equal to your level + an amount of d6s equal the amount of sorcery points spent. You can only spend an amount of sorcery points on this feature equal to half your level in this class, per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Puppets
entries: At 18th level, you gain the ability to channel all of your manipulative energy into a physical manifestation of control. As an action, you spend 6 Sorcery Points and gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You gain immunity to Psychic damage, as well as being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}.
At the start of every turn, you can choose whether or not a creature either Charmed or Bound to you takes psychic damage equal to your Charisma modifier + your Proficiency Bonus.
When you deal Psychic damage with a spell or class feature, you can add your Charisma Modifier to the damage roll.
Creatures have disadvantage on their save against {@subclassFeature Force the Hand|Sorcerer||Puppeteer|ToL|6}.

subclassFeature.name: Lumeerian Gunslinger
entries: {@italic Inspired from Matthew Mercer's Gunslingers and altered to fit Lumeeria}

In the vast and varied world of Lumeeria, where magic and technology intertwine in unexpected ways, Gunslingers are a rare breed of warriors who have mastered the art of wielding firearms with deadly precision. Armed with their trusty pistols, rifles, or other exotic firearms, Gunslingers navigate the dangers of their world with a blend of steely resolve, quick reflexes, and a keen eye for their target.

subclassFeature.name: Firearm Proficiency
entries: Upon choosing this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item Tinker's Tools}.

Your proficiency with {@item Tinker's Tools} allows you to maintain, repair, and even create firearms. You can use your Tinker's Tools to craft ammunition, repair damaged firearms, or even design and construct new firearms, subject to your Dungeon Master's discretion. Your knowledge of firearms and their mechanisms grants your insight into their operation, giving you an edge in combat and ensuring your weapons remain in top condition.

subclassFeature.name: Firearms: Ammunition
entries: All firearms require specialized ammunition to function properly. Due to their rarity, finding ammunition for firearms can be challenging. However, with your proficiency in Tinker's Tools, you can craft your own ammunition at half the cost using gathered materials. Each type of firearm typically uses its own unique ammunition, which is often sold or crafted in batches to ensure compatibility with the weapon's design. As a Gunslinger, your ability to craft ammunition ensures that you're never caught unprepared when the bullets start flying.

subclassFeature.name: Firearms: Firearm Properties
entries: Firearms come in many different variations all from small flintlock pistols to large expensive sniper rifles.
Firearms in Lumeeria have replaced the optional ones presented in the {@table Adventuring Options; Firearms|DMG|Dungeon Master's Guide}.
Firearms can be found in the {@table Lumeerian Gunslinger: Firearms Table|ToL|Firearms Table}.

subclassFeature.name: Adept Marksman
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you learn to perform powerful trick shots to disable or damage your opponent using your firearms.

entries.name: Trick Shots:
entries: Trick Shots. You learn four trick shots of your choice, which are detailed under {@subclassFeature Gunslinger: Trick Shots|Fighter||Lumeerian Gunslinger|ToL|3|ToL|Trick Shots} below. Many trick shots enhance an attack in some way. Each use of a trick shot must be declared before the attack roll is made.
You learn two additional trick shot of your choice at 7th, 10th, 15th and 18th level. Each time you learn a new trick shot, you can also replace one trick shot you know with a different one.

entries.name: Grit:
entries: You gain a number of grit points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) + your proficiency bonus. You regain 2 expended grit point each time you roll a 20 on the d20 roll for an attack with a firearm. You regain all expended grit points after a short or long rest.

entries.name: Grit:
entries: Some of your trick shots require your targets to make a saving throw to resist the trick shot's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

entries.name: Bullying Shot:
entries: You can use the powerful blast and thundering sound of your firearm to shake the resolve of a creature. When making a Charisma (Intimidation) check, you can expend one grit point to gain advantage on the roll.

entries.name: Dazing Shot:
entries: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one grit point to attempt to dizzy your opponent. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must make a Constitution saving throw or suffer disadvantage on attacks until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Deadeye Shot:
entries: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one grit point to gain advantage on the attack roll.

entries.name: Disarming Shot:
entries: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one grit point to attempt to shoot an object from their hands. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must succeed on a Strength saving throw or drop 1 held object of your choice and have that object be pushed 10 feet away from you.

entries.name: Forceful Shot:
entries: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one grit point to attempt to trip them up and force them back. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you.

entries.name: Piercing Shot:
entries: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one grit point to attempt to fire through multiple opponents. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and you make an attack roll with disadvantage against every creature in a line directly behind the target within your first range increment.

entries.name: Winging Shot:
entries: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one grit point to attempt to topple a moving target. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Violent Shot:
entries: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one or more grit points to enhance the volatility of the attack. If the attack hits, you can roll one additional weapon damage die per grit point spent when determining the damage.

entries.name: Blinding Shot:
entries: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one grit point to attempt to blind your target with a well-aimed shot. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Concussive Shot:
entries: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend three grit points to unleash a concussive blast with your shot. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Staggering Shot:
entries: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one grit point to disrupt their balance and coordination. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have its movement speed reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Swift Shot:
entries: You can expend one grit point to make a lightning-fast shot, allowing you to fire your firearm with incredible speed. When you use this shot, you can make one additional firearm attack as a bonus action on your turn.

entries.name: Smoke Bomb Shot:
entries: You can expend one grit point to load your firearm with a specially prepared bullet that releases a cloud of obscuring smoke upon impact. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage, and a 10-foot radius sphere of thick smoke is created at the point of impact, {@table Screen; Obscured Areas|screendungeonkit|heavily obscured} the area for 1 minute. Smoke Bomb Ammunition is required to use this Trick shot and costs 20sp to make.

entries.name: Disrupting Shot:
entries: You can expend one grit point to fire a disrupting shot that interferes with a creature's concentration. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage, and if it is concentrating on a spell, it must make a Constitution saving throw with disadvantage to maintain concentration from the damage of this attack.

entries.name: Harassing Shot:
entries: You can expend one grit point, to fire a harassing shot that distracts and annoys your target. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must succeed on a Wisdom (Insight) check against your Trick Shot DC or it has disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than you before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Startling Shot:
entries: You can expend one grit point, to fire a shot designed to startle your opponent, causing them to lose focus momentarily. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage, and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on its next saving throw until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Grit Guard:
entries: As a reaction to an ally being hit with a critical hit by an attacker within 30 feet, you can expend 2 grit points. You quickly toss a bag of black powder onto the attacker, attempting to distract them enough to disrupt their critical hit. The attacker and the affected ally must both be within 30 feet of you for this trick shot to take effect
The attacker must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or the critical hit is turned into a normal hit. Any effects triggered by a critical hit are canceled.

subclassFeature.name: Quickdraw
entries: When you reach 7th level, you add your proficiency bonus to your initiative.
Furthermore, when you roll for initiative, you can expend up to a maximum of 3 grit points to boost your initiative score. For each grit point spent in this way, your initiative score increases by 2,

subclassFeature.name: Quick Thinking
entries: Upon reaching 10th level, your sharp wit and quick reflexes enable you to recalibrate your aim when your shots go awry in the heat of battle.

Once per round, when you miss with an attack roll, you can add your Intelligence modifier to the roll to potentially hit the target. If the modified roll is successful, you also add your Intelligence modifier to the damage dealt.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, regaining expended uses after completing a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Quick Movement
entries: Starting at 15th level, you gain an additional 10 feet of movement, and you can use the {@action Disengage}, or {@action Dash} action as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Slinger's Aim
entries: When you reach 15th level, you add half of your proficiency bonus (rounded down) to attack rolls with firearms.

subclassFeature.name: Vicious Intent
entries: At 18th level, your firearm attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19-20, and you regain a grit point on a roll of 19 or 20 on a d20 attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: Hemorrhaging Critical
entries: Upon reaching 18th level, whenever you score a critical hit on an attack with a firearm, the target additionally suffers half of the damage from the attack at the end of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Soul Guide
entries: {@italic Reflavor of Long Death Monk to fit the narrative of Dangur}

Monks of the Way of the Soul Guide, are beings that are touched by the Retriever of Evildoers. The few that Kalin, The Black Angel chooses, are destined to look over the transition between life and death for the most wicked of souls. Soul Guides are a sacred people, that is deeply respected by the few that know of them. Soul Guides help uphold the divine balance that keeps the world of Lumeeria from descending into chaos.

subclassFeature.name: Touch of Death
entries: Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level, your connection to death allows you to extract vitality from another creature as it nears its demise. When you reduce a creature within 5 feet of you to 0 hit points, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier + your monk level (minimum of 1 temporary hit point).

subclassFeature.name: Guide of the Corrupt
entries: Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you gain the ability to guide the corrupt souls to the plane of Judgement, Uzelon.

You can spend a minute to collect the soul from a humanoid corpse. This ritual can fail for various reasons, whereas some examples for the reasons are as follows. If the soul is no longer there, if the humanoid was not of the evil alignment or if you already hold a corrupt soul in your body.

Successfully performing the sacred ritual, you now carry with you the corrupt soul in your body. This can lead to various experiences and dangers, such as hearing persuasive whispers, catching glimps of memories or even becoming possessed. But it all depends on the soul.

When you are located at a temple of Kalin, The Black Angel, you can spend an hour performing a ritual where you implore Kalin to appear and receive the corrupt soul, so that she can lead it to Uzelon. For each corrupt soul that you guide to Kalin, you grow stronger, as shown on the Guide of the Corrupt Table.
After Guide of the corrupt has been used, and the corrupt soul is gone from your body. You must take a long rest before using this feature again.

items: You have advantage on initiative rolls.
By spending an bonus action observing a humanoid, you can make an insight check against their deception check. If you succeed, you learn if the target is of the evil alignment or not.
You gain a dragonfly spirit, as per the spell {@spell Find Familiar}, requiring no material component.
You can as a bonus action manifest black ethereal feathered wings on your back that give you a flying speed equal to half your speed. After a minute the wings dissapear.
You no longer need to be located at an temple of Kalin, to implore her to appear.
You now deal 1d(Martial Die) extra necrotic damage on all your Melee Strikes
You can now cast the spell {@spell Plane Shift} requiring no material component, once per day.

items.name: Keeper of The Corrupt
entries: You attempt to banish yourself and a creature to an endless demiplane. You touch a creature and the target must suceed on a Wisdom Saving throw against your Ki Save DC. On a fail, both you and the target are transferred to a realm of infinite emptiness removed from all other planes.
Within this realm, neither you or the creature age or need to breathe, eat, drink or sleep and are functionally immortal. You cannot be reduced below 1 hit point.
Time flow feels normal for you, but in truth it is a 100 times slower. Escape through conventional magical means, including teleportation or planat travel, is impossible.
You can end this effect as an action.
Alternatively, the target of this feature, can make a Wisdom check against your Ki Save DC, this can be done after 1 minute since arrival. On a success the effect ends.
Each failure increases the waiting period before another attempt can be made, from 1 minute to 1 hour, 1 day, 1 year, 1 decade, 1 century and ultimately capping at 1 millenium.

Upon conclusion of the effect, both you and the target are returned to your original locations or to the nearest unoccupid space, with your original hit points from when the Keeper of the Corrupt was initially activated.
Keeper of the Corrupt can be done once every 7 days.
{@italic Keeper of the Corrupt is greatly inspired by AdramastesGM on Instagram}

subclassFeature.name: Hour of Reaping
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to unsettle or terrify those around you as an action, for your soul has been touched by death. When you take this action, each non-friendly creature within 30 feet of you that can see you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Mastery of Death
entries: Beginning at 11th level, you use your connection with death to escape its grasp. When you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can expend 1 ki point (no action required) to have 1 hit point instead.

subclassFeature.name: Touch of the Wicked
entries: Starting at 17th level, your touch can channel the energy of death into a creature. As an action, you touch one creature within 5 feet of you, and you expend 1 to 10 ki points. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, and it takes {@dice 2d12} necrotic damage per ki point spent on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

subclassFeature.name: Steward of Balance
entries: Stewards of Balance is a secret global organization that self-proclaim themselves as the stewards of Zybris, The Judge of Souls.
This organization is infamous for being Neutral to the affairs of the world, only venturing out of their hidden temples if a name has been fated.
Stewards of Balance have the ability to essentially become anyone, where they use their manipulative abilities for the greater good of the cosmic balance.

subclassFeature.name: Stewards of the many faces
entries: Stewards have the ability to become anyone.

When a humanoid dies near you, you have 12 hours to attempt to extract their persona. When extracting a persona you spend an hour attempting to surgically remove their face along with their personality, memories and mannerism. You must succeed on a Intelligence check to successfully collect their persona
You can spend a minute to put on a face. You can have an amount of faces equal to your Intelligence Modifier plus your Proficiency Bonus.
You can remove one face from your collection whenever you short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Socially Intelligent
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your intellect gives you confidence in social situations. You add your intelligence modifier to all charisma skills checks.

subclassFeature.name: Quick Mind
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your quick thinking lets you act quicker. You can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Intelligence Modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Undoubtable Trust
entries: Starting at 9th level, you can use the trust of others to your advantage. While wearing a face of someone and you are conversing with an individual who undoubtably trusts the face. You can choose to auto succeed any Charisma Skill Check against the individual.
You can use Undoubtable Trust an amount of times equal to your Intelligence Modifier per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Deceptive Confusion
entries: Starting at 9th level, you can for a short time cause a target to become confused and charmed by you.

You can as a bonus action, target a humanoid creature within 30ft. Your face flickers momentarily in that creatures vision and they see their loved ones instead of you. The target must succeed on an Wisdom (insight) check against your deception. If they fail, they are charmed by you until the end of your next turn. While they are charmed by you in this way, you have advantage on the attack rolls against them.
You can use Deceptive Confusion an amount of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Insightful Technique
entries: Starting at 13th level, you can use your insight about your enemies to your advantage.

Whenever you are fighting an individual that is associated with a face from your collection. You can on the first attack made on each of your turns, add your intelligence modifier to your attack and damage rolls. You do not need to be wearing the face to gain this benefit.
Examples of association can be. Same Guild, Same Cult, Same Party, Same Clan.

subclassFeature.name: Insightful Precision
entries: Starting at 17th level, you gain the ability to strike at your enemies with a deadly precision
Whenever you are fighting an individual that is associated with a face from your collection. You gain the following benefits.

items: You attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.
You ignore the previous requirements for gaining sneak attack. However, if you have disadvantage on the attack roll, you still cannot gain sneak attack.

subclass.name: Way of the Soul Guide
subclassFeatures: Way of the Soul Guide|Monk||Soul Guide|ToL|3

entries.name: Soulburner
entries: Soulburners are whispered about in hushed tones, their existence veiled in mystery and dread. They are feared not only for their formidable combat abilities but also for their controversial practice of soul manipulation. In a world where souls are the essence of life and balance, the Soulburner's unorthodox methods have drawn the ire of religious orders and individuals alike. The cosmic balance of Lumeeria hinges on the free flow of souls, and any disruption to this delicate equilibrium is met with swift and severe retribution. Despite this, or perhaps because of it, Soulburners continue to walk their perilous path, driven by an insatiable thirst for power and mastery over their own destiny.

As Soulburners harness the power of their own souls to fuel their abilities, they walk a precarious path between power and peril. Each act of soul manipulation exacts a toll on their physical and spiritual well-being, eroding away at their vitality and life expectancy. The exact toll this takes on their longevity remains unknown, but it is widely believed that few Soulburners live to old age. The lure of power may be irresistible, but the cost of wielding soul power is steep indeed, and only the most determined and resilient souls dare to embrace its dark embrace.

Soulburners have often been regarded with suspicion and fear, their abilities associated with darkness and corruption. Throughout history, there have been infamous individuals who have embraced the path of the Soulburner, wielding their power with ruthless efficiency. Among them, none are as notorious as Tionne Vestes, whose name is synonymous with destruction and chaos.

Tionne Vestes, delved deep into the forbidden arts of soul manipulation, becoming a feared Soulkeeper of unparalleled strength. Through unknown means, he transcended the boundaries of conventional Soulkeeper abilities, forsaking his martial prowess in favor of wielding soul power with unmatched potency.

His legacy is one of devastation, as he brought ruin to the once-beautiful Feylands, leaving a trail of destruction in his wake. Tales of his atrocities echo through the annals of history, serving as a grim reminder of the dangers posed by those who dare to harness the power of the soul. Despite his eventual downfall, Tionne Vestes remains a cautionary tale, a testament to the dark allure and perilous consequences of delving too greedily and too deeply into the forbidden arts of soul manipulation.

entries.name: Threatening Nature
entries: Furthermore, the very nature of the Soulburner often leads them into conflict with those who uphold the sanctity of souls. Most religious individuals, including clerics, paladins, priests, and even deities and devils, view Soulburners with suspicion and disdain. Simply by virtue of their existence, Soulburners are perceived as a threat to the cosmic order, prompting opposition from those who seek to maintain balance and purity in the realm. NPCs who discover the true nature of a Soulburner may become openly hostile or actively work against them and their goals, driven by fear or a sense of duty to preserve the natural order.

spell.name: Sapphire's Healing Rain
entries: Vitality bursts forth as rain cascades down in a 40-foot radius sphere, originating from a point of your choosing within range. You select up to six creatures of your choice within the sphere. Each of these creatures regains hit points equal to {@dice 8d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier.
Furthermore, any undead within the sphere must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they suffer {@damage 4d6} radiant damage.

components.m: A crystal tear worth at least 100 Gold, consumed

spell.name: Evermoor's Photon Cannon
entries: You extend your hand, conjuring arcane energy in the form of brilliant photons. Make a ranged spell attack against a target within range. On a successful hit, the target is struck by a powerful beam of radiant energy, suffering {@damage 5d6} radiant damage. The intense force of the concentrated energy propels you backward 10 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd. The radiant beam becomes even more potent with the infusion of additional arcane power.

spell.name: Adran's Disabling Eye
entries: You create a semi-translucent eye that hovers in a location of your choice within range. This eye temporarily disables all invisibility and illusion magic within 90 feet of it. Any {@condition invisible} creatures or illusions within range become visible and their illusionary nature is revealed while the eye is active. If an {@condition invisible} creature or illusion exits the 90-foot range of the eye, the invisibility or illusion effect returns.

m.text: A glass eye worth 50gp, not consumed

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the eye remains until dispelled.

spell.name: Sova's Undead Mount
entries: The pile of bones or corpse is engulfed in black flames; the smoke forming the body of the risen mount. You decide the mount's appearance though regardless the mount retains a look of undeath indicating its undead nature.
The risen mount is a Large creature that uses the statistics of the warhorse though it is an undead instead of a beast.
Your mount responds to verbal commands and can understand any language that you speak.

When your mount drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. You can also dismiss your mount at any time as an action, causing it to disappear in a plume of black smoke. In either case, casting this spell again heals your risen mount, restoring it to its hit point maximum.

components.m: The corpse of a large creature or one large pile of bones, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Sand Stepping
entries: You and up to 5 willing creatures you choose within range become enchanted with the magic of the desert, gaining the ability to traverse sandy landscapes with unprecedented speed.
While under the effect of Sand Stepping, your movement speed increases to 60 feet while traversing sand.
If you are hit by an attack or offensive spell while the spell is active, its effect is immediately dispelled, and the enchantment is lost.
The spell provides protection against the abrasive forces of sandstorms. Sand Stepping ignores {@status concentration} checks caused by damage taken during such harsh weather conditions.
Dashing while under this spell has no effect.

components.m: Gold covered amber worth 50 Gold, Not Consumed

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration increases by 2 hours for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Naza's Divine Resurgence
entries: You beseech the divine energies, manifesting as radiant motes of light, to breathe life back into those who have fallen. When you cast this spell, up to three {@condition unconscious} creatures of your choice within range regain hit points equal to {@dice 3d4} + your spellcasting modifier. As the divine energy lifts them, they are also raised from a {@condition prone} position.

spell.name: Adran's Ice Spear
entries: You create three spears of ice and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.

Make a ranged spell attack for each spear. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} cold damage, and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. Speed reduction can stack with each hit.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create on additional spear for each slot level above 2nd

spell.name: Nitto's Water Wave
entries: As you hold your hands with thumbs touching and fingers spread, a thin sheet of water shoots forth from your outstretched fingertips. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Strength saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d8} Cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The water pushed any creature that failed the save, back 5 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Thunder Fist
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a target. On a hit, the thunderous energy is released, affecting the target and other creatures in a 15-foot cone originating from the target's position.

Each affected creature, including the target, must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

Additionally, unsecured objects that are completely within the area of effect are automatically pushed 10 feet away from you by the spell's thunderous force, and a booming sound echoes audibly up to 300 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st. The Target is additionally pushed back 5 more feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Azizas' Way of Fire
entries: You concentrate the elemental powers of fire. The next time you make a ranged weapon attack during the spell's duration, the weapon's ammunition, or the weapon itself if it's a thrown weapon, bursts into flame. Make the attack roll as normal. The target takes {@dice 2d10} extra fire damage on a hit. The piece of ammunition or weapon then returns to its normal form.

spell.name: Sova's Animate Limbs
entries: This spell summons a {@creature crawling claw} and a {@creature Stomping Foot|oow} to serve as temporary undead servants. Choose a pile of bones, a corpse, or a severed hand of a Medium or Small humanoid within range. Your spell imbues the target with a foul mimicry of life, creating a crawling hand and a stomping foot as undead creatures. The crawling hand and stomping foot remain for 1 minute. When this time expires, the creatures are destroyed.

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command either the crawling hand or the stomping foot if they are within 60 feet of you. You decide what action each creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular area. If you issue no commands, the creatures only defend themselves against hostile creatures. Once given an order, each creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

components.m: a drop of blood, a piece of flesh, and a pinch of bone dust

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, your undead servants remain indefinitely. There can be no more than 3 sets of Crawling Claw and Stomping Foot under your control.

spell.name: Spectral Blast
entries: A blast of spectral necrotic energy streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Fey Guest's Refuge
entries: Fey Guest's Refuge offers sanctuary to a select number of individuals, shielding them from the dangers posed by the Aetherwall that surrounds the Feylands. When cast, the spell envelops the caster and up to a number of willing creatures equal to their spellcasting ability modifier plus their proficiency bonus, granting them protection for 24 hours while within the Feylands.

Under the spell's influence, those affected are safeguarded against the perils of the Aetherwall, which threatens to unravel their memories and displace them in time. As long as they remain under the effect of this spell for the entirety of their stay in the Feylands, they are shielded from the adverse effects of the Aetherwall, ensuring their experiences remain unaltered and coherent.

To invoke Fey Guest's Refuge, the caster must trace arcane sigils in the air and infuse the spell with the essence of a Moonpetal Bloom, a rare and ephemeral flower native to the Feylands. Once the casting is complete, the protective aura extends to the designated individuals, allowing them to traverse the Feylands with confidence and security for the duration of the spell.

components.m: a Moonpetal Bloom, consumed

spell.name: Evermoor's Lightning Shackles
entries: You create bolts of lightning that arcs toward 3 targets of your choice that you can see within range.
A target must make a dexterity saving throw. The targets takes {@damage 3d8} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful.
On a failed save the target is {@condition restrained} by lightning shackels for up to 1 minute.
A creature {@condition restrained} by the shackles can use its action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

components.m: A piece of amber

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you create an additional bolt of lightning for each slot level above 3nd.

spell.name: Flashburst
entries: You unleash a burst of blinding light and deafening sound at a point within range. Each creature within a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}.

components.m: A small crystal or glass sphere

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd. Additionally, the radius of the sphere increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Naza's Calming Aura
entries: As you sit and concentrate on the spell, you create a calming aura around yourself. Up to three individuals within a 10-foot radius of you can join your aura by sitting and meditating, refraining from other activities or rest.
After an hour has passed, the individuals within the aura, excluding yourself, experience a soothing effect, reducing their level of {@condition exhaustion} by one.

components.m: 75 gold worth of silver chains for each individual affected, consumed

spell.name: Shadow Trace
entries: Shadow Trace is a potent divination spell that allows the caster to track a creature or object by placing an {@condition invisible} magical mark upon it. When casting the spell, the caster must touch the target creature or object. Once the spell is cast, the caster becomes aware of the exact location of the marked target at all times, even if they are no longer on the same plane of existence. The mark is {@condition invisible} and cannot be detected by normal means.

Additionally, if the caster possesses a crystal ball, they can choose to link the Shadow Trace spell to it. This creates a visual link between the caster and the marked target, allowing the caster to see everything within 30 feet of the target as if they were standing there themselves. However, no sounds are transmitted through this link.
The Shadow Trace spell lasts until it is dispelled. The mark can only be seen by spells or effects that can detect invisibility or magic, such as See Invisibility or Detect Magic.

components.m: a small piece of black silk thread worth 50 gp, Consumed

spell.name: Kalezandra's Reflective Barrier
entries: Kalezandra's Reflective Barrier envelops a target object no larger than huge in an {@condition invisible} barrier over the course of 1 hour. The object cannot be worn or carried.

While the barrier remains active, any creature that targets the protected object with an attack is struck by psychic damage equal to the damage dealt to the barrier, as the attack's force is reflected back upon the attacker.
Any attempt to physically pass through the wall will result in taking {@damage 2d10} psychic damage and be repelled.
The {@condition invisible} barrier can be detected by any means that allow the user to see {@condition invisible} objects.

components.m: a Platinum key worth 100 gold, consumed

spell.name: Sova's Undead Army
entries: Threads of dark power leap from your fingers to pierce up to ten Small or Medium corpses you can see within range. Each corpse immediately stands up and becomes undead. You decide whether it is a zombie or a skeleton (the statistics for zombies and skeletons are in the Monster Manual), and it gains a bonus to its attack and damage rolls equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

You can use a bonus action to mentally command the creatures you make with this spell, issuing the same command to all of them. To receive the command, a creature must be within 120 feet of you. You decide what action the creatures will take and where they will move during their next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a chamber or passageway against your foes. If you issue no commands, the creatures do nothing except defend themselves against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creatures continue to follow it until their task is complete.
The creatures are under your control until the spell ends, after which they become inanimate once more.

components.m: A diamond in the form of a skull worth at least 500 gold, consumed

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you animate up to 5 additional corpses for each slot level above 7th. Additionally, the duration of the spell is extended by 2 hours for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Sova's Knights
entries: Necrotic energies gather at your fingertips as you pull from the grounds two {@creature Skeletal Knight|ToL}. (the statistics for Skeletal Knight are in Tales of Lumeeria}

You can use a bonus action to mentally command the creatures you make with this spell, issuing the same command to both of them. To receive the command, a creature must be within 60 feet of you. You decide what action the creatures will take and where they will move during their next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a chamber or passageway against your foes. If you issue no commands, the creatures do nothing except defend themselves against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creatures continue to follow it until their task is complete.
The creatures are under your control until the spell ends, after which they become inanimate once more.

components.m: a ruby in the form of a skull worth at least 800 Gold, consumed

spell.name: Sova's Death Guard
entries: Verbal Command Word: "Rise and serve"

You draw upon the powers of Axion, The Celestial Necropolis, to summon a {@creature Death Knight} to serve as your eternal guardian. As you utter the incantation, a spectral figure clad in dark armor materializes in an unoccupied space within range.

The Death Knight remains in your service until it is destroyed or until you choose to dismiss it as a bonus action. You can only have one Death Knight at a time. While it remains by your side, it follows your commands without question, bound to you by an unbreakable telepathic bond. This bond persists even across different planes of existence.

Though loyal to you, the Death Knight possesses its own initiative in combat and acts independently. It considers you its eternal master and will offer strategic guidance if requested, but it never disobeys your commands.
The Death Knight's statistics are determined by the Dungeon Master. It cannot be healed by any magical means, but it benefits from the same restorative properties of a long rest as you do.

components.m: A piece of the blighted citadel from Axion, the celestial necropolis, not consumed

spell.name: Umbrator's Helping Hand 🙂
entries: You speak words of encouragement that carry an arcane twist to them, letting them clear their minds in times of turmoil. Creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you can add {@dice 1d6} to skill checks if they are proficient in the skill they are rolling for. If the skill has any other bonus applied to it, such as expertise or permanent advantage, they cannot benefit from this spell.

spell.name: Umbrator's Disrupting Beam
entries: You hold the coin in your hand and conjure a spectral eye in front of you. The eye shoots a flat beam of magical disturbance towards your enemies. Each creature in a 30-foot line in front of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} force damage, or half as much on a success.

Additionally, if a creature hit by this spell is currently {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell, it has disadvantage on the {@status concentration} saving throw caused by this spell, unless it succeeded on the initial Dexterity saving throw.

components.m: a platinum coin, not consumed

spell.name: Umbrator’s Black Ice
entries: You cover the ground in imperceptible ice, hindering the movement of your foes. Choose one of the following shapes: Line, Cone, Square. For every 10 feet moved across the ice, a creature must make a Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.
Line: Ice shoots out from your hand and covers a 60-foot by 10-foot line.
Cone: The ground in a 15-foot cone from you is covered in ice.
Square: A 15-foot square within 60 feet of you is covered in ice.
If a spot covered by ice created by this spell, it can only be removed by magical fire. Coming into contact with any kind of magical fire will melt a 5-foot square, as appropriate.
If a creature has its movement enhanced by any kind of magic, it is immune to the effects of this spell.

components.m: Water droplets

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the cone or square created by this spell increases in size by 5 feet.

spell.name: Sapphire's Conjure Water
entries: You open a small portal in the bottle or waterskin you are holding to the Elemental Plane of Water, conjuring water that is either salty or fresh, flowing from the object.

You produce 10 gallons of water. If used offensively, it gushes forth in a water jet 30 feet long and 1 foot wide. As a bonus action, you can aim the jet at a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage and fall {@condition prone}.
Alternatively, you can target an object that isn't being worn or carried and that weighs no more than 200 pounds. The object is either knocked over or pushed up to 15 feet away from you.

components.m: a Bottle or Waterskin

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the amount of gallons created increases by 10, and the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level of slot expended beyond the 1st.

spell.name: Sapphire's Sanctum
entries: You send forth a shimmering piece of Sapphire into the air within the range. Upon reaching its destination, it radiates a soft, enchanting light, creating a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on the Sapphire. For the duration of the spell, any hostile creature that enters the sphere for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Charisma saving throw.
Bane (Enemy): On a failed save, enemies within the sphere are affected by the Bane spell while inside its confines.
Bless (Ally): Allies within the sphere are bestowed with the Bless spell, their spirits lifted by the sanctified aura.
If an enemy succeeds on the saving throw, they become immune to the effects of Sapphire's Sanctum for the next 24 hours.

Moving out of the sphere causes the targets to lose the respective effects. As an action, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet, adjusting its protective influence to different areas of the battlefield.

components.m: A small piece of Sapphire

spell.name: Ral's Mobile Aid
entries: You spend time creating a Mobile Aid construct. Upon finishing the creation of {@creature Ral's Aiding Construct|ToL}, you choose its appearance and design.(The statistics for Ral's Aiding Construct are in Tales of Lumeeria}
The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The construct is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the construct shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands without requiring any action from you. If you don't issue any commands, it takes the Dodge action and uses its movement to avoid danger.

spell.name: Ral's Ranged Shield
entries: In a swift reaction, you extend your hand, deploying an ingenious artificer creation that materializes before your designated ally within range. This mystical construct provides enhanced protection. Until the start of your next turn, the targeted ally gains a bonus to their Armor Class equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Crafted by the inventive mind of Rallientha, this spell allows artificers to swiftly extend their defensive expertise to allies, ensuring they are shielded from imminent threats.

spell.name: Ral's Empowered Infusion
entries: With a swift bonus action, you extend your hand, forging a connection with a weapon under your infusions. The next strike unleashed by the chosen weapon carries a surge of enhanced power, dealing an additional {@damage 2d10} force damage.
Crafted by the inventive mind of Rallientha, this spell allows artificers to swiftly extend their defensive expertise to allies, ensuring they are shielded from imminent threats.

spell.name: Nightshades' Moonbeam
entries: For a brief moment, you gather Lotoza's moon energy in your palm. As you slam your wrists together and aim your palms at your target, a beam of compact moonlight flashes out from your palms in a 10-foot wide, 60-foot long line. Each creature in the line must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 12d6} radiant damage. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage. Undead and oozes have disadvantage on this saving throw.

If the spell is cast at night and while in an area where it's outside and there is visibility to Lotoza, the red moon, then Nightshades' Moonbeam has a reddish color to it and will deal an extra {@dice 6d6} while being 5 feet wider.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, each instance of damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Sova's Corpse Explosion
entries: As you snap your finger, a dead creature within range, that you know of, explodes with necrotic energy. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on the dead creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 5d8} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The spell can also be cast on an undead creature that is under your control.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d8} and the radius increases in size by 5 feet for each slot level above 4nd.

spell.name: Nitto's Vitality Orb
entries: You summon forth a shimmering orb of water infused with the healing essence of the sea. With a swift motion, you propel it towards a point of your choosing within range, where it bursts into a radiant explosion of droplets. Each droplet carries the essence of rejuvenation, healing the wounds of creatures within a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point. Each creature in the area regains hit points equal to {@dice 6d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier as the healing waters cascade over them, restoring vitality and vigor.

components.m: a piece of Golden Bloom seaweed, consumed) (Unique

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Evermoor's Tornado
entries: You conjure a swirling vortex of air that rapidly ascends to the sky in a 20-foot-radius, 60-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range. Each creature in the cylinder must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, they are lifted up 60 feet into the air and become {@condition restrained}.

At the end of your next turn, the tornado dissipates, and all creatures caught in the air come plummeting down, taking fall damage equal to {@dice 6d6}. Tiny or Small creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw, while Huge or Gargantuan creatures have advantage.

components.m: a golden eagle's feather worth 100 gold, not consumed

spell.name: Greater Haste
entries: You infuse a creature with supercharged energy, allowing it to move and act with incredible speed. Until the spell ends, the target's speed is doubled, It gains a +3 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and It gains an additional action on each of its turns. This action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.
If the affected creature has the extra attack feature, it can make two attacks instead of one when taking the Attack action granted by this spell.

Upon the spell's end or if the affected creature is knocked {@condition unconscious}, the intense burst of energy fades, leaving the creature lethargic. The target can't move or take actions until after its next turn, and it gains {@dice 1d4} levels of {@condition exhaustion}.

components.m: licorice root covered in gem dust worth at least 1000 gp, consumed

spell.name: Evermoor's Power Word Fall
entries: You speak a word of power that resonates with arcane force, overwhelming the body of one creature you can see within range.

If the target creature has 150 hit points or fewer, it is unable to withstand the immense pressure and is forcefully pushed to the ground by arcane forces. The creature becomes {@condition restrained} and {@condition prone}, unable to move freely. Additionally, it suffers {@damage 5d10} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 5d10} force damage as the magical energy crushes and batters its form.
Should the target creature have more than 150 hit points, the spell has no effect, leaving the creature unharmed and unaffected.

The {@condition restrained} creature can attempt to break free from the magical restraint by making a Strength saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the restraining effect ends, allowing the creature to stand once more.

spell.name: Sova's Undead Beasts
entries: Sova's Undead Beasts is a dark necromantic spell that grants the caster the ability to raise an undead creature from a pile of bones or a corpse of a Medium or Large beast within range. The spell imbues the target with a foul mimicry of life, transforming it into an undead creature of the caster's choice: {@creature Undead Brown Bear|ToL}, {@creature Undead Tiger|ToL}, or {@creature Undead Dire Wolf|ToL}. (The DM determines the creature's game statistics)

Once animated, the undead creature follows the mental commands of the caster, who can use a bonus action on each of their turns to direct its actions. The caster can command the creature to perform specific actions, such as attacking a target or guarding a location, or issue general commands for self-defense. The undead beast remains obedient to the caster's commands until its task is completed or the duration of the spell expires.
The duration of Sova's Undead Beasts is up to 1 hour. Once this time elapses, the magic sustaining the undead creature fades, and it is destroyed, returning to its lifeless state.

components.m: a drop of blood, a piece of flesh, and a pinch of bone dust

spell.name: Sova's Dead Giants
entries: Upon casting, the caster must choose either a corpse of a giant or five medium humanoid corpses within range. If humanoid corpses are chosen, they stretch and fuse in gruesome ways, mimicking the size and strength of a giant. The spell imbues the target with a vile mockery of life, transforming it into an undead creature of the caster's choice: {@creature Zombie Giant|ToL} or {@creature Skeleton Giant|ToL}. (The DM determines the creature's game statistics)

Once animated, the undead creature follows the mental commands of the caster. As a bonus action on each of the caster's turns, they can mentally command the creature if it is within 60 feet. The caster can dictate the creature's actions and movement for its next turn or issue general commands such as guarding a specific location. If no commands are issued, the creature will defend itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

The caster maintains control over the undead creature until the spell's {@status concentration} ends, after which the creature's bones turn to ash and are destroyed, leaving little to no trace of its existence.

components.m: A tiny statue of a giant worth at least 300 gold, not consumed

spell.name: Evermoor's Gigantification
entries: Upon casting, the caster selects either a willing creature or an unattended object that is neither worn nor carried. The caster cannot target themselves with this spell. The chosen target undergoes a dramatic growth spurt, expanding to huge size for the duration of the spell. If there isn't sufficient space for the target to fully grow to huge size, the spell fails.
While under the effects of Gigantification, the target gains the following benefits:
{@b Huge Size:} The target grows to huge size, towering over its surroundings.
{@b Bonus Damage:} The target deals an additional {@damage 2d6} extra damage with its attacks.
{@b Strength and Constitution Advantages:} The target has advantage on all Strength checks and Strength and Constitution saving throws}
{@b Double Damage to Objects and Structures:} The target inflicts double damage to objects and structures with its attacks.
{@b Extra Hit Points:} The target gains 30 additional maximum hit points for the duration of the spell.

{@b Climbable:} Adjacent creatures may spend half of their movement to attempt a DC 15 Strength (Athletics) check to climb onto the target. While climbing on the target, a creature has advantage on melee attacks against it, and the target has disadvantage on melee attacks against the climbing creature.

components.m: A tiny statue of a giant worth at least 500 gold, consumed

spell.name: Effer's Shade
entries: By holding up a silvered mirror, you conjure a Shade – an illusionary duplicate of yourself that emerges from the reflective surface. The Shade is not a tangible creature but a projection of your likeness, slightly transparent and ethereal.
The Shade has a flying speed equal to double your own movement speed and can move freely, following your mental commands on your turn.

While the Shade cannot pass through solid walls, it can effortlessly move through creatures and objects, allowing it to traverse openings such as windows or average wooden doors. Observers can discern the Shade's illusory nature with a successful investigation check (DC equal to your spell save DC), or if they witnessed you casting the spell.
At the end of your next turn, a silver light emanates from the Shade's last location, and you instantaneously teleport to that position.

components.m: a silver mirror worth 25 gold, not consumed

spell.name: Rivel's Ignite
entries: You choose a creature within range that you can see. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d8} fire damage, and an additional {@damage 2d8} fire damage on your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage with no follow-up damage.

components.m: A claimed Fireshard Crystal, not consumed

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, both of the damages increase by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Rivel's Red Star
entries: Verbal Command Word: "Enflare...Unite"
{@b Enflare:}

A beam of scorching red light erupts from your outstretched finger, rapidly expanding into a 10-foot-wide beam that stretches the full range. Each creature within this fiery path must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 10d6} fire damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.
Choose a specific point along the beam's trajectory. At this chosen point, a diminutive red star materializes, quickly imploding and absorbing all the fiery energy from the beam.
{@b Unite:}

The red star violently explodes in a spectacular display, unleashing a devastating 30-foot-radius, 300-foot-high cylinder of searing heat. The origin point of the cylinder is the location of the imploded red star. Creatures within this cylinder must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 12d6} fire damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The intense heat of the explosion damages objects within the area, incinerating flammable objects that are neither worn nor carried.

At the apex of the cylinder, if the explosion occurred in an area where the cylinder reached its maximum height, a lingering effect remains. A transparent red star is suspended, emitting enough radiant light to cast Bright light for up to 1 mile in every direction. The red star persists for a thousand years. The first 500 years there bright light in 1 mile. The last 500 years it becomes dim light.

components.m: Consumes a Claimed Fireshard crystal

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the base damage of both the Enflare and Unite phases increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 7th. The fiery force unleashed becomes more potent, consuming everything in its path with ever-growing intensity.

spell.name: Keldi's Displacement
entries: You choose a point within range that you can see. Each unwilling creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d4} force damage and is teleported 20 feet away from the center of the sphere. On a successful save, nothing happens.
The space for the teleportation must be unoccupied and on the ground or a floor.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4}, and the distance teleported increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Vitality Surge
entries: With a sinister incantation, you tap into the life force of others, empowering them with renewed vitality. Choose two willing creatures within range. Each target can expend 1 hit die, rolling it and regaining hit points equal to the result plus their Constitution modifier plus your Spellcasting Modifier.

components.m: a pendulum dripping with blood

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the number of targets increases by 1, and the number of hit dice that can be expended increases by 1 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Insightful Initiative

time.condition: which you take when you roll for initiative

entries: Upon seeing the outcome of the initiative roll, you or a friendly creature within range that you choose gain sudden insight, allowing them to reroll their initiative with advantage. The creature can choose to use the new roll or keep the original result. This spell must be cast immediately after the initiative roll is made but before the turn order is finalized.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the chosen creature gains a bonus to their initiative roll equal to +2 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Obliteration
entries: You target a creature that you can see within range. They disappear in an echoing scream, leaving behind a single drop of their blood. The targeted creature becomes {@condition incapacitated} and experiences intense pain, as their body is transported to a demiplane filled with the target's worst nightmares, taking 20 psychic damage.

On any subsequent turns, they take 20 psychic damage and afterwards they can attempt to make a charisma saving throw. On a success they reappear in the space they left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

While in the demiplane, if the targeted creature is reduced to 50 hit points or fewer, they immediately die as their bones, along with any magic items they wore, appears in the space they left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

spell.name: Sova's Deathly Hand
entries: You manifest a ghostly hand that reaches out and touches a creature that you can see within range. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 10d10} necrotic damage on a failed save and you gain half the amount of necrotic damage as temporary hit points.
If the saving throw fails by 10 or more, the creature dies and the caster gains no temporary hit points.

components.m: A ruby in the form of a hand worth at least 300 Gold, Consumed

spell.name: Nightshade's Moon Fall
entries: You stretch out your arm, reaching for something, as you manifest a piece of the Red Moon Lotoza as it comes plummeting down to the ground.

Choose a point within range. A shimmering portal opens in the sky above that point, revealing a fragment of the Red Moon Lotoza hurtling towards the ground. You can adjust the size of the resulting sphere upon casting, ranging from 50 feet to 120 feet in radius.

Each creature within the chosen sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw for each damage type from the spell. The sphere spreads around corners. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 10d10} bludgeoning damage, {@damage 10d10} fire damage, {@damage 10d10} radiant damage, {@damage 10d10} cold damage, and {@damage 10d10} force damage. On a successful save, the damage is halved.
The spell also damages objects in the area, shattering and incinerating them. Additionally, upon impact, the spell leaves behind a permanent crater with 20-foot-tall walls surrounding the area.

components.m: a piece of the Red Moon Lotoza, not consumed

spell.name: Nightshade's Wolven Aspect
entries: As you cast this spell, a gigantic spectral and translucent wolf, emanating a protective aura, materializes around you, symbolizing your connection with the spirit of the wolf.
The wolf takes on a specific elemental aspect, chosen from acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison, which manifests visibly within its form
Your body undergoes a transformation and you gain the following benefits until the spell ends.
{@bold Fur}. Your body becomes covered in fur that aligns with the appearance of the wolf, increasing your armor class by 3. Additionally you become immune to damage of the chosen element.
{@bold Movement}. You gain an additional 30 feet of movement speed.

{@bold Spectral Wolf}. During your turn and on each subsequent turn for the duration, the wolf can make a swipe attack as a bonus action, unleashing a powerful force in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw, suffering {@damage 6d8} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

components.m: a statuette of a wolf, worth at least 500 gp, consumed

monster.name: Skeletal Knight
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the Skeletal knight to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is bludgeoning or from a critical hit. On a success, the skeletal knight drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The skeletal knight doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skeletal knight makes three Enervating Blade attacks.

action.name: Enervating Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) necrotic damage, and if the target is a creature, it can't regain hit points until the start of the skeletal knight's next turn.

action.name: Healing Wave
entries: Ral's Aiding Construct heals all non-construct allies within 20ft by 11 ({@dice 2d10}) + your spellcasting modifier hit points

action.name: Repair (1/Day)
entries: While Ral's Aiding Construct cannot heal from conventional healing, it can repair itself. As an action, it can restore {@dice 4d8} + your spellcasting modifier hit points to itself or to one construct or object within 5 feet of it.

trait.name: Vigilant
entries: Ral's Aiding Construct can't be surprised

trait.name: Bloodbound
entries: The Blood Seneschal shares level with the creature he is Bloodbound with

trait.name: 3rd Level: Coagluate (3/Day)
entries: As an action, the Blood Seneschal empowers the blood of up to 2 creatures within 30 feet of it. Each target can expend 1 hit die, rolling it and regaining hit points equal to twice the result plus their Constitution modifier.

trait.name: 5th Level: Blood Puppet (3/Day)
entries: As an action, the Blood Seneschal chooses a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or move up to their speed in a direction of the Blood Seneschal's choice. During this movement, the Blood Seneschal can force them to make one attack against a creature of the Blood Seneschal's choice. (No action Required)

trait.name: 7th Level: Blood Bondage (1/Day)
entries: As an action, the Blood Seneschal arrests the hearts of up to 3 creatures within 30 feet of it. Each target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage and is {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Constitution saving throw.
On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition paralyzed}.

trait.name: Undying Grasp : Weaker Foes
entries: When the Blood Seneschal successfully deals damage to an undead creature with a challenge rating (CR) of 1 or lower, the damage of the Blood Seneschal acts as a bane to the creature's very existence. The undead is instantly destroyed.

trait.name: Undying Grasp : Unyielding Dominance
entries: The Blood Seneschal permanently has advantage on its attack rolls against undead creatures of a challenge rating above 1.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: At 7th level, the Blood Senechal makes two Blood Curse attacks

action.name: Signature Attack (Blood Curse).
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5ft. or ranged 60ft., one target. Hit 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) Necrotic Damage, and the target is {@condition poisoned} until the end of the Blood Seneschal's next turn.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The tiger has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the tiger moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the tiger can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The bear has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bear makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Bite
